subject: Re: EVP and James Randi -- My Questions
author: earthangel5998
full_text:
Thanks Misty...I know the whole James Randi thing is ridiculous. I 
would just LOVE to see him knocked off his high horse. I am a natural 
skeptic yet I "know" something is out there and can't wait to find it 
for myself. Thanks for the tips, I'm still confused but I'll read up 
on that link and check out the You Tube tutorials, I appreciate your 
guidance and look forward to learning and making progress in this 
fascinating field. Have a great day :) 

Angela 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Angela
> 
> LOL! Why dont they just give the winning lotto numbers that would 
be 
> easier to aquire =)
> 
> Personally I never seek to prove this to anyone, they should 
> prove/disprove it themselves. Even amongst those who arent 
skeptics, 
> hearing varies. Sometimes everyones hears the same sometimes they 
> dont. 
> 
> I also dont ask about lotto numbers LOL I dont play it.
> 
> As for building one yourself, most are trying out the radio 
> modifications like the 12-470 or the 12-469 (horrible clicking on 
the 
> 469 model but a few have gotten around it. Theres a few others 
Frank 
> and Steve have messed with. I think ones the 12-125 but I am a bit 
> tired so all the model numbers arent popping in my head at the 
moment.
> 
> A few "how to" videos have been posted on youtube. You can type in 
> the model numbers to access a few of Mike Colletta's (ufogeek)
> available posts as well as several others who have made thier video 
> instructions available online. 
> 
> I did try out a fan test session the other day. Tho they werent as 
> loud as with water, I could still discern a few statements. They 
were 
> so "bass" in tone that its almost out of my hearing range on a few 
so 
> I didnt post them all. As for the ones I did they can be found on 
my 
> esnips 
> 
> http://www.esnips.com/web/MiscellaneousMethodsofEVP
> 
> That should take ya to the right folder
> 
> Misty
